alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 22 at 3:19PM EST until December 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Two-day total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches are expected through Saturday. The least amount of snow will be along Highway US-2 in southern Schoolcraft County. Winds gusting as high as 50 to 55 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches into this evening. * WHERE...Alger, Luce, Southern Schoolcraft and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 1 AM Friday to 7 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult to impossible by Friday and is not advised. Considerable blowing snow will cause blizzard conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause power outages.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft
